author: James Syoen
title: Lower humidity this weekend

Comfortable weekend ahead, tracking another cold front
We have very dry air in place right now at the mid upper levels of the atmosphere, and with the dewpoint in the 50s and many locations, it will be very pleasant and comfortable through the weekend. Our next cold front will likely arrive on Tuesday, and it’s only going bring us a very small chance for rain. However, behind this front on Tuesday,, mornings will get down into the 40s on the North Shore, and afternoon highs will only be in the 70s for much of next week. In the tropics, there are two systems in the open waters of the Atlantic, and one tropical wave with a 50% for development over the next few days, but as far as were concerned, the tropics are quiet.
NEW ORLEANS —
We have very dry air in place right now at the mid upper levels of the atmosphere, and with the dewpoint in the 50s and many locations, it will be very pleasant and comfortable through the weekend. Our next cold front will likely arrive on Tuesday, and it’s only going bring us a very small chance for rain. However, behind this front on Tuesday,, mornings will get down into the 40s on the North Shore, and afternoon highs will only be in the 70s for much of next week.
